column4: One of the techs told me to zero-fill the drive to try and fix it. Seeing as GParted can't seem to delete my primary partition and Disk Utility doesn't seem like it wants to give in. I did somehow get the drive to format in disk utility.
be sure to enable trim for the drive in /etc/fstab
I never zero-filled a drive before so I pretty much am new to the computer term and doing it.
More or less I'm going to wait for confirmation from the tech.
I dont see any advantages to doing that. but if 'trim' is not enalbed, you'll shorten the life of the ssd
Nice to know that if it shortens the lifespan I can always ask the tech.
Zeroing the drive seems like the only way I can install Ubuntu unless I buy a new SSD which I'm not going to do.
why do you have to zero the drive at all? Because it's hanging at install? Ive had an SSD drive do that to me when it was installed in a computer that didnt support it properly
Because I simply cannot install Ubuntu.
I tried installing Ubuntu using the USB installer to install on top of the SSD. Instead, the USB installs on top of the USB and not the SSD.
that does not sound like theres a problem with the ssd

What had happened is I wanted a fresh install of Ubuntu 12.04 LTS to clear the Ubuntu 11.10 junk out so I went about my business and use the LiveUSB. Went through the installation process and checkmarked 'encrypt my home folder' there was no progress indicator to verify indication of how long it takes to encrypt a drive. So in turn I thought the installation stalled or hanged I mistakenly powered off the machine and Ubuntu wouldn't

From there on end I ended up trying to check GParted and Disk Utility the encrypted partition was not possible to delete it had about 15GB of harddrive space. I tried deleting it in GParted and Disk Utility to no luck...from there when I tried to reinstall Ubuntu for some odd reason it didn't install from the SSD but it installed on the USB.
try without encription? or does it just not work anymore? I would boot gparted and see what the partition looks like, and delete it from there.
I can't delete the primary partition within GParted the delete button is grayed out.
Somewhat implying that it's mounted and can't be unmounted.
I'm using GParted on the LiveUSB but isn't so called Live anymore when the installation is completely on the USB.
yeah, its still live if its the install iso
